column1: Apolipoprotein B100 (apoB100) is a protein that plays a role in moving cholesterol around your body.
This is a form of high cholesterol that is passed down in families (inherited).
This article discusses the test used to measure the level of apoB100 in the blood.
An abnormal result may mean you have high lipid (fat) levels in your blood.
Other disorders that may be associated with high apoB100 levels include angina pectoris (chest pain that occurs with activity or stress) and heart attack.
